metadata.feature_description: Manages regex patterns to identify and handle duplicate content during search crawling

test_scenarios.scenario_name: View list of all duplicate patterns

steps.action: Navigate to Admin > Settings > Site Settings > Search > Crawling tab
steps.expected: Crawling tab is displayed with Duplicates section
steps.actual: Crawling tab displayed with Duplicates section showing list of existing regex patterns

steps.action: Scroll to view the Duplicates section
steps.expected: List of duplicate patterns is visible with Description and Regex Pattern columns
steps.actual: Duplicates section displayed with multiple existing patterns including tabid, ctl terms, linkclick, dnn forum, dnn blog, etc.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Add new duplicate pattern with description and regex

steps.expected: Add pattern form appears with Description and Regex Pattern fields
steps.actual: Form appeared with empty Description and Regex Pattern text fields, plus Cancel and Save buttons

steps.action: Enter 'test category pattern' as description and 'categoryid=\d+' as regex pattern
steps.expected: Form fields populated with entered values
steps.actual: Description set to 'test category pattern' and Regex Pattern set to 'categoryid=\d+'

steps.expected: Pattern is saved and appears in the list
steps.actual: Pattern 'test category pattern' with regex 'categoryid=\d+' successfully added to the list

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Add pattern with invalid regex and verify validation error

steps.action: Click 'Add Regex Pattern' button and enter '[invalid(regex' as an invalid regex pattern
steps.actual: Invalid regex pattern '[invalid(regex' entered in the Regex Pattern field

steps.action: Click Save button with invalid regex
steps.expected: Validation error message displayed indicating invalid regex
steps.actual: Error message 'Invalid Regular Expression pattern' displayed, preventing save

steps.action: Click edit icon on 'test category pattern' row
steps.expected: Edit form opens with current values populated
steps.actual: Edit form opened showing Description: 'test category pattern' and Regex Pattern: 'categoryid=\d+'

steps.action: Change description to 'test category pattern edited'
steps.actual: Description changed to 'test category pattern edited'

steps.expected: Pattern updated in list with new description
steps.actual: Pattern description successfully updated to 'test category pattern edited' in the list

steps.action: Click edit icon on the pattern row
steps.actual: Edit form opened with current regex 'categoryid=\d+'

steps.action: Change regex pattern to 'categoryid=(?<uniqueid>\d+)[^&]*' and description to 'test category pattern unique v2'
steps.expected: Regex field updated with new pattern
steps.actual: Regex changed to 'categoryid=(?<uniqueid>\d+)[^&]*' and description to 'test category pattern unique v2'

steps.expected: Pattern updated in list with new regex
steps.actual: Pattern successfully updated with new description and regex pattern in the list

steps.action: Attempt to save pattern with values that already exist
steps.actual: Error message 'Duplicate pattern already exists.' displayed when attempting to save with duplicate values

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Delete duplicate pattern and verify removal

steps.action: Click delete icon on 'test category pattern unique v2' row
steps.actual: Confirmation dialog displayed: 'Are you sure you want to delete test category pattern unique v2?' with No and Yes buttons
Pattern 'test category pattern unique v2' successfully removed from the duplicates list

observations: The system validates regex patterns and displays 'Invalid Regular Expression pattern' error for invalid regex syntax
Duplicate pattern validation is enforced - error 'Duplicate pattern already exists.' is shown when attempting to save a pattern that conflicts with existing entries
Edit and delete operations require navigating to the correct icon - the UI has two icons per row (edit and delete)
The confirmation dialog for delete operation correctly shows the pattern description being deleted
All CRUD operations (Create, Read, Update, Delete) for duplicate patterns work correctly
